body:

```
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.OutOfMemoryException`: Exception of type 'System.OutOfMemoryException' was thrown.
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.set_Capacity(Int32 value)
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.EnsureCapacity(Int32 min)
   at OpenRA.Network.SyncReport.GenerateSyncReport(Report report)
   at OpenRA.Network.SyncReport.UpdateSyncReport()
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Note that our computers don't go into hibernate, sleep standby.  They are set to "never sleep" but blank the screen after 10 minutes or so.

Interestingly this time around I know that OpenRA was not focused when I left it as I printed some stuff off before heading off.  During the overnight pause it was focused.

Our LAN is hardwired gigabit.  The computers are in the same room plugged into the same gigabit switch.

Not sure if any of this is at all helpful.

I also have logs from a previous game that crashed but with a different call stack.

`Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20161001
on map 840f63d00c762924ceed53cdc837cf43b5759256 (Huge Island Northwest [190x190] by James Bunting).

[Logs 2016-10-07 2109 Huge Island Northwest [190x190].zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/522446/Logs.2016-10-07.2109.Huge.Island.Northwest.190x190.zip)

The Problem is that OpenRA.Game.exe is an X86 binary (32Bit) so it can only use <= 2 GB Memory (limited by windows) currently we have a few of this problems and will hopefully fixed by this: #12138 
If you handy and have the Visual studio 2015 Community Edition you can do the following to fix it yourself until #12207 is included in the next playtest or release for windows which enables > 2GB support

*open cmd.exe and type `CD "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\bin"` then press enter
- then run in the command prompt `editbin /LARGEADDRESSAWARE <openra.game.exe-fullpath>`
- then run in the command prompt `editbin /LARGEADDRESSAWARE <dll-files-fullpath>`
- restart the Game

*If you have Replays from matches which crashed so send them also to us

This is interesting.  We have VS2015 on both machines as we sometimes compile the dev version to keep up-to-date with critical fixes.

I will try this workaround and report any problems if they arise.
the make.ps1 doesnt include the fixheader.exe in the make process on windows thats why the DLLs and exe files doesnt get patched to use more than 2GB
